/* Life cycle of HIV */ - correcting some errors and assumptions
In the U.S. the three criteria for an AIDS diagnosis is: 1) a CD4 count <200, 2) one or more opportunistic infections and 3) a CD4% <14%. Having HIV antibodies is not a marker for an AIDS diagnosis.
